post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Wednesday, June 3 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag, you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 1:38 PM ·

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
March 30 at 5:17 PM ·

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Let’s navigate this new normal together.

post_text: Rabun County School Nutrition will provide meals at NO COST for all children ages 2 – 18 (children do not have to be Rabun County Students). Meals will be available on Mondays only; however, you can pick up meals for the whole week at this time. Meals will be available for pickup at the Primary School Bus Loading Area (10am-12pm), the Mountain City Flea Market (10am-12pm), Vista Ridge Apartments on Marsen Knob Dr. (10am-12pm), Dunlap Apartments (10am-10:30am), Stavemill Apartments (10:40am- 11:15am), and Clayton-Duckett Apartments (11:15am-12pm). Children must be present to pick up meals.

post_text:
Graduation - Group Photo
Congratulations to Mountain Education Charter High School Graduating Class of 2019! The Graduating Seniors from the Rabun Site are on the third row, beginning with the 8th student from the left: Blake Burnette, Aaron Thompson, Savannah Sanchez, Gracie Curbow, Kaylyn Shilling, Cullan Luther (High Honor Graduate), Maggie Gaglio, and Dani Lanier.
The faculty and staff of the Rabun Site are extremely PROUD of all of our graduates and wish them much success in their futures!

post_text: It's that time of year! Come celebrate the MECHS Class of 2019 at our first annual combined graduation. All 16 of our sites will graduate together this year. We look forward to seeing everyone on Saturday, May 25 at 1:00 p.m. at the University of North Georgia Convocation Center in Dahlonega, Georgia. A reception will follow.

post_text: Another BIG thanks to members of Timpson Presbyterian Church for sponsoring Module Madness for the week of January 7-11. Five students were rewarded for their efforts in finishing at least 2 modules during the week. For their efforts, students received $30 gift cards to Ingles. The hardworking students pictured are: Maggie Gaglio, Mark Groscope. Students not pictured are: Cullan Luther, Isaac Snider, and Michael Fowler-Berken. Way to go, students and thank you, Timpson Presbyterian!

post_text: On Thursday, January 10, staff at Rabun MEC participated in Staff Development regarding "Building Bridges to Address Student Barriers". Each staff member was asked to consider a barrier to student success and to determine a solution (bridge) that might assist students in overcoming that barrier. The staff at Rabun MEC are dedicated to helping our students SUCCEED by breaking down barriers!

You must be present at the time of the drawing to win!

post_text: HONESTY is our theme for the month of January at the Rabun MEC site. Honesty is a facet of moral character that connotes positive and virtuous attributes such as integrity, truthfulness, straightforwardness, including straightforwardness of conduct, along with the absence of lying, cheating, theft, etc. Honesty also involves being trustworthy, loyal, fair, and sincere. HOW WILL YOU DISPLAY HONESTY THIS MONTH?

post_text: The theme of Mountain Ed for the month of December is Generosity. Faculty and staff donated food and other goodies. Members of Rabun’s Student Voice helped compile bags for students to take home over the holidays. In addition, students were able to “shop” for personal hygiene items. We wish everyone a very Merry Christmas and Happy 2019!

post_text: On November 29, nine students from Rabun MEC took a workplace visit to Mountain Lakes Medical Center in Clayton, GA. Students were able to see many areas of the hospital including surgery, ER, the lab/blood services, and the business office. Afterward, students were treated to dinner in the cafeteria. Mountain Lakes is supported by 161 hospital employees, including more than 60 nurses. What a wonderful opportunity to see a potential workplace in Rabun County. Thank you to Mountain Lakes Medical Center!

Thank you to Mountain Lakes Medical Center!

post_text: Noah Hedden was the winner of the November Attend to Achieve incentive at the Rabun site. Noah won a Fitbit Versa! Many congrats to Noah! Attend to Achieve is an attendance incentive program at each Mountain Education Charter High School site. One faithful attender will win each month. The prize for December is a pair of Beats Headphones.

A HUGE shout out and THANK YOU to Timpson Presbyterian Church for sponsoring "Module Madness" for the week of November 12 - 15.

Students who completed at least 2 modules during the week received a special visit and were awarded $15 gift cards.

Way to go students and thank you members of Timpson Presbyterian!!

post_text:
I successfully completed Basic Combat Training last week. Thank you for all your hard work. I could not have completed this step in my life if it was not for the staff of Mountain Education Charter High school! You guys are the best! - Troy Christopher Giovino

Stories and students like this are what we work so hard for. Join us in Congratulating this successful young man.

post_text:
The staff and students at Rabun MEC are proud of two of our recent graduates who are members of the Armed Services - Noah Fructman (pictured) and Troy Giovino.

We are PROUD of you and thank you for your service.

We also send positive thoughts and prayers to our Superintendent, Dr. Wayne Lovell, who is actively deployed with the National Guard.

Happy Veteran's Day to all our Veteran's!!!
